extractions.description: The paper discusses a modification to the classic cop and robber game on graphs, introducing a new light-dismantling procedure to address issues with a fast robber. It proposes a monotonic winning strategy for a cop on undergrounded graphs, a generalization of classical dismantlable graphs.

type.justification: The paper primarily deals with theoretical concepts in graph theory and strategies for games on graphs, without mentioning empirical experiments or data.
type.quote: In this paper, we prove a similar result for a game on a finite graph where the robber can travel through arbitrary many edges in a single move.

name.justification: The research paper discusses a game on graphs and the concept of dismantlable and cop-win graphs, which are central topics in graph theory.
name.quote: Nowakowski and Winkler [5] introduced a game on graphs where a cop tries to catch a robber; in particular they showed that the cop has a winning strategy on a (finite or infinite) graph if and only if the graph is dismantlable.
